WorkItem.Description:
I have v1.0.0.5 installed in  VS 2010 with the default configuration. I have 1 .chirp.css file and 1 .chirp.less file. Those are working perfectly. The first one is generating a minified .min.css file upon saves. The second file is transforming into a .css file and minifying to a .min.css file upon saves.

I have a .chirp.config file that mashes the 2 minified files together without further minifying them. Here is the .chirp.config file:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?>
<root xmlns="urn:ChirpyConfig" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
	<FileGroup Name="merged.css">
		<File Path="baseline.min.css" Minify="false" />
		<File Path="prototype.min.css" Minify="false" />
	</FileGroup>
</root>

The merged file was created immediately, as expected. However, now when I make changes to the second file, prototype.chirp.less, and save it, merged.css is not regenerated automatically (prototype.min.css is properly updated). In addition, I can save prototype.chirp.less 2 times in a row to force merged.css to update. In some cases, even saving the less file twice won't initiate the merged.css update (this is rare, but does happen).

I understand that this is a chained relationship: prototype.chirp.less auto-updates prototype.min.css which should be detected by the .chirp.config file in order to auto-update merged.css. Perhaps, this is the source of the issue. It sounds reasonable since a double save seems to work 99% of the time.

I've tried setting the Minify attribute to false on the FileGroup instead of the individual File elements without better success.


Love this tool, by the way!
WorkItem.Summary: Saving .less File not Updating Mashed File Always
